body.name: PurSteam Steam Iron for Clothes 1700W with Self-Cleaning Nonstick Stainless Steel Soleplate, Auto Shutoff, Anti-Drip

byLineInfo.name: Visit the PurSteam World's Best Steamers Store

deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 16 hrs 17 mins
features: Rapid Heating – Our Professional Steam Iron 1700W heats in just 30 seconds! Stainless Steel Soleplate – True position axial holes direct the maximum amount of steam. Use it as a handheld steamer or with your ironing board.
3-Way Auto Shutoff – Our iron for clothes automatically shuts off and alerts you when the iron is left unmoved: horizontally (30 sec); vertically (8 min); tipped sideways (30 sec).

Preset Modes – Choose from preset fabric modes on this clothes iron: low (synthetics, viscose, polyester), medium (silk, wool), or high (cotton, linen). Use the spray button or burst of steam to add creases or remove stubborn wrinkles.
Vertical Steaming – This is an iron and steamer all in one. Use a burst of steam on drapes, hanging clothes, and as an upholstery cleaner. Iron uses regular tap water.
Many Features – Along with auto shutoff, the iron includes an anti-drip system to prevent dripping at low temps and a self-cleaning feature to keep the soleplate gliding smoothly.
body.description: Many Steam Options Our professional iron features Axial Steam Holes to maximize the amount of steam due to the size, alignment, and placement of the soleplate true position holes. You’ll notice the results in the iron’s even heat distribution. This steam iron has many options: (1) Continuous Steam in the horizontal position; (2) Vertical Steam for touchups, clothes on a hanger or big jobs like curtains; (3) Spray to iron pleats or creases; and (4) Burst of Steam for smoothing tough wrinkles. Precision Stainless Steel Soleplate with Axial Steam Holes Voltage and Frequency: 120 V, 60 Hz Long 8 ft Power Cord with Swiveling Cord Protector Self-Cleaning Button Anti-Drip System Large Water Tank Capacity: 14 fl oz (420 ml) Preheating Time: 30 seconds

productInformation.name: Included Components
productInformation.value: Easy Thermostat Control & Axial Steam Holes - Based on fabric type, you can easily select the ideal steam output and keep the temperature how you like it. The placement, alignment and size of our steam holes gives you the maximum amount of steam required while maintaining even heat distribution throughout the soleplate., Ultra-press Stainless Steel Soleplate - Thick chromium finish soleplate for durability, scratch resistance and unparalleled glide; specially designed steam distribution is perfect for sewers, quilters and crafters., Cut Your Ironing Time In Half - With our Rapid Even Heat Technology and 1700-Watts of Power you can easily glide across various garments and smooth hard-to-reach areas. Our PurSteam steam iron provides you with ideal temperatures for cotton, wool, silk, linen, polyester, nylon and more., Safety Features - Keeping you safe at all times with our automatic 3-way shut off system, avoiding accidents and burnt clothes. With our new Anti-Drip feature you don't have to worry about water dripping out of the soleplate at low temperatures or when the iron is not in use. ANTI-CALC prevents mineral build up., Unsurpassed Quality/ Live Customer Support - Water drops in the tank? Do not fear! This just means your PurSteam steam iron was thoroughly tested before arriving at your home. Our rigorous testing process ensures the best quality possible. Each and every iron is filled with water and tested to make sure it works perfectly! And our support will make sure you're 100% satisfied!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Use Tap Water Stop storing distilled water! PurSteam irons use regular tap water (up to 12 grains of hardness). A self-cleaning feature helps remove scale from inside the iron’s soleplate so your iron glides smoothly. Garment/Fabric Settings Use the knob to select your fabric type. Wait for the green light before ironing when you change the temperature. The iron temp will adjust, and a light will blink as you use it to maintain the temp. Refer to the fabric label when determining fabric type. Remove Wrinkles with Ease Easily add a burst of steam or spray water (in a fine mist or a quick jet) with the conveniently located steam settings. Steam can quickly remove stubborn wrinkles or press in sharp creases.

Burst of Steam Powerful bursts of steam emit from our professional-grade iron thanks to its 1700W of power. Many Steam Options Our professional iron features Axial Steam Holes to maximize the amount of steam due to the size, alignment, and placement of the soleplate true position holes. You’ll notice the results in the iron’s even heat distribution. This steam iron has many options: (1) Continuous Steam in the horizontal position; (2) Vertical Steam for touchups, clothes on a hanger or big jobs like curtains; (3) Spray to iron pleats or creases; and (4) Burst of Steam for smoothing tough wrinkles. Precision Stainless Steel Soleplate with Axial Steam Holes Voltage and Frequency: 120 V, 60 Hz Long 8 ft Power Cord with Swiveling Cord Protector Self-Cleaning Button Anti-Drip System Large Water Tank Capacity: 14 fl oz (420 ml) Preheating Time: 30 seconds

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High Quality, Durable Iron
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to purchase a high end Rowenta like I am used too but it was too expensive. I read all the reviews and the Pursteam iron was comparable and less than half the price. I was not disappointed in my purchase. The iron works perfectly, I do not have to turn the heat up as much as I used too, steam function is great and works very well. There is weight to iron which I personally like as it irons smoothly. The lead is long, and the water container is larger than most. So pleased with my purchase, I would buy another.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good price. Very capable iron.
reviews.reviewText: I’m writing this detailed review because I found the subject of researching, purchasing, and using under-performing irons so annoying and hoping this will help you avoid the same. This review applies to my personal application and experience. Both of those may differ for you.First some context for this review. I pretty much exclusively use the iron to iron my long sleeve dress shirts for work. I work fast and need an iron that can keep up with me (producing steam) as I iron, set the iron down, move the shirt to the next position, iron set the iron down etc. about 10 times per shirt. I set the iron to ‘Cotton” and get busy. I just need an iron that constantly produces plenty of steam. I don’t use the spray or vertical steam features. It takes me about 3 minutes per shirt – which is faster and cheaper than making trips to the cleaners. I have not had any of the irons long enough to provide a long-term or reliability review. If anything annoying occurs I will come back and edit this review if I am able.I purchased and tested each of these irons on the same shirts (pic)1) First purchase: Rowenta Focus $87Summary: this iron could not keep up with me. Seemed to produce steam randomly in short bursts when it felt like it. I often found myself ironing soleplate down without any steam at all. I thought the unit must be defective. I returned in exchange for another one. Same issue with the second one.I would return it if I could, but am outside the return window. I would not recommend this iron. Will be donating this to charity. Maybe it will suit someone else better.Will not bother with Pros & Cons here.2) Second purchase: Rowenta Steamforce $152Summary: upon opening, it was clear that this was a unit had already been ordered and returned by another customer. Based on past experience accepting somebody else’s return is a nonstarter – especially at this price point. This is not the first time Amazon has sent someone else’s reject as new. Very disappointing. I returned in exchange for another one. The second one arrived in new and unused condition – although I wish the manufacturer would seal the box at the factory so it is clear if the box has been previously opened.Pros:- Slick easy gliding soleplate- Plenty of steam- Simple light indicating fabric setting (pic)- Narrow nose for tight spaces- Simple on/off steam setting (I don’t need anything in between)Cons:- Price – yikes!- Easy to accidentally hit fabric selection dial and change setting. Frustrating.- A little bit of non-consequential spittingThis was the best of the three irons for my needs. Would recommend.3) Third purchase: PurSteam Professional Grade 1800-Watt Iron with Digital LCD Screen $42Summary: this one arrived in a box properly sealed by the manufacturer – easy to tell that I was the first person opening the box. Thank you!Pros:- Great price- Sufficient steam- LED fabric selector - No manual dial to knock out of position. Yay! Thank you! (pic)- Easy to fill water tankCons:- Literally ran out of steam when tank reached 25% full (pic)I would recommend this iron. Instead of returning, I will keep as a very capable backup.Hope this review saves you some of the time and grief I experienced. If anyone has recommendation for a top-notch ironing board cover, I’d be happy to hear about it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wool setting not as hot as expected, steam settings not fully adjustable, misleading pictures
reviews.reviewText: This iron overall seems very good, though the pictures at the top of the page show the 1800 watt version with the LCD screen with the description for the 1700 watt version…so I thought the only difference between was the wattage and price. That was my fault for not scrolling further down the item page to see the actual pictures of the product. Amazon, maybe fix this issue?On to the iron itself, It does heat up quickly and seems to work great on the cotton temp and steam settings, but the wool temp setting with the appropriate steam setting doesn’t seem as hot as my previous Hamilton Beach iron. I also wish the steam setting slider was fully adjustable…this only allows for 3 settings based on which temperature you’ve selected. This again doesn’t lead to as much steam coming out on the wool temp setting. My previous iron allowed me to dial in an ideal amount of steam output. I can certainly play with the settings and see what works best, but just these couple of nitpicks. Otherwise I’m pretty happy so far with it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this iron. It is nice and light, and easy to fill. I have no problem seeing just were the water is. Get nice and hot and the steam is good. I would differently recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Iron ever for the price advertised
reviews.reviewText: I only purchased the Shark drip free irons because they work great. Unfortunately I can’t find them anywhere. I decided to get this one and I love it. The iron has so many cool features and it also has a filter inside for calcium and other sediments. It does not drip water. I tried it on stubborn wrinkles and it does the work well. I did see the iron advertised in other retailers but the price was way too high. I hope this helps you with your purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fun to iron now
reviews.reviewText: Ironing is not my favorite thing to do. My old iron was 30 years old and a relic plus didn’t work well. It was time I got a new iron. I was due for an upgrade and glad I did. Now ironing is a breeze and this iron is amazing. Love the way the settings are easy to use and that you can use tap water. The linen setting is the best for our new linen sheets. Yes, I’m ironing sheets and pillowcases now! Lol!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great steam iron!
reviews.reviewText: Nice weight but not too heavy. Works great, dress shirts look nice and crisp 👍
Muy fácil de manejar y planchar

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Great iron, nice and light, excellent quality, terrific value, fast delivery.
Es un poquito pesada como negativo pero el tamaño, deposito de agua, la maniobrabilidad, los orificios del vapor y en general todo el aparato es buenisimo (segun me dijo mi mujer)...ella la calificó

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use and good steam
